docs.text: Hello Alistair Collins is a Software Engineer from Scotland, with a broad knowledge of web technologies including, but not limited to: PHP (OOP 7.x, XDebug, PHPUnit, CakePHP 2.x, Laravel 5.x, Lumen), Javascript (including angularjs, jQuery, Node.js, npm), WebSocket HTML, CSS (including Bootstrap), MySQL, Bash Docker Other exposure to tools/technolgies: AWS (EC2, RDS, S3) Python, pip Java, maven Domain registrar, DNS Profiles: Stackoverflow Bitbucket Github Linkedin dev.to

docs.text: College I joined Kilmarnock College to study Computing to a level high enough to gain entry to university. HNC HND Here you can see a brief description about the classes taken and the projects undertaken in each. Year 1 (HNC) 11 Classes Year 2 (HND) 9 Classes
docs.title: Summary

docs.text: I joined Kilmarnock College to study Computing to a level high enough to gain entry to university. HNC HND Here you can see a brief description about the classes taken and the projects undertaken in each. Year 1 (HNC) 11 Classes Year 2 (HND) 9 Classes
docs.title: College

docs.text: Year 1 (HNC) DH36 34 Graded Unit Type: HNC Award Multiple choice questions on many aspects of computing and software development. Pass with Grade A. FK8A 34 Troubleshooting a Desktop OS Type: Computer Systems Troubleshooting common and not so common issues in Windows 7 and Windows Server. Followed material from Microsoft books for the MS70-685 exam. FK89 34 Configuring a Desktop OS Type: Computer Systems Configuring many common and not so common aspects within Windows 7 and Windows Server. Followed material from Microsoft books for the MS70-680 exam. DH33 34 Computer Operating Systems Type: Computer Systems Writing of very detailed instructions on how to perform common OS tasks, troubleshooting and configuration. Describe structure and function of an OS. Install and configure system and application software. DH2T 34 Computer Architecture Type: Theory and Algorithms Basics of computer systems, understanding the functions of system components. Manipulate and translate data representations and demonstrate an understanding of the principles of CPU operation. DH3E 35 Structured Programming Type: Software Construction Introduction to Java and programming concepts (variables, operators, predefined functions, standard I/O, control structures, parameter passing, data structures). Involved the implementation of given design, that of a simple library management system - and the production of relevant user, technical and testing documentation. DH3G 34 Object Oriented Programming Type: Theory and Algorithms Creation of a system as part of a group while creating plans, creating agendas, keeping minutes, etc. DH2R 34 Developing Multimedia Applications Type: Software Construction Developed an interactive quiz with multimedia teaching web technologies (Apache, PHP, HTML, SQL) using VB.NET and HTML. DH35 34 Planning Type: Professional Development Using project planning software and learning about different software development methodologies. D75X 34 IT Applications Software Type: Software Construction Using lesser known features of IT applications (namely MS office) to create powerful tools and new applications.
docs.title: Year 1 (HNC)

docs.text: Year 2 (HND) DN4N 35 Graded Unit Type: HND Award HND Graded unit involved the production of a software system (a Hotel Booking System) based on specifications obtained via interviews, meetings and questionnaires. As well as the software system, the production of planning, implementation and evaluation documentation was required Pass with Grade A. DH30 35 Applications Development Type: Software Construction Health centre application in MS Access with VBA scripting. DH31 35 Array Data Structures Type: Theory and Algorithms Introduction to abstract data types and sorting algorithms in C++. DH32 35 Development for WWW Type: Information Systems Website development with HTML, PHP and SQL. I created a DVD review site using the technologies metioned plus javascript and PDO for DB. DH3C 35 Object Oriented Programming Type: Software Systems The object oriented approach to systems development (abstraction, inheritance, polymorphism, encapsulation) and use these techniques to create a software system. In this case I developed an airplane booking system in C#. DH3F 34 Systems Development Type: Theory and Algorithms Introduction to OO design and formal design documentation, such as class diagrams, use case descriptions, system interactions, data flow diagrams, entity relationships, data normalization, etc. F0N0 35 Professional Issues Type: Professional Development Describe professional institutions (BSC and IEEE) within computing and legalisation that applies to the computing profession and evaluates its impact. Evaluate the codes of conduct within the computing profession and apply ethical principles within computing. DM30 35 Project Management Type: Professional Development Introduction to project management, GANTT, PERT and Microsoft Project. DE2N 35 3D Modelling and Animation Type: Theory and Algorithms Basics of animation and modelling. I created a Newton's cradle in Blender with random balls falling from the sky. .vid { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; padding-top: 30px; height: 0; overflow: hidden; } .vid iframe, .vid object, .vid embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }

docs.text: Projects I run a NAS on my home network, which includes file shares ( smb with samba ) for Steam library and a Plex library. My home network also has a Raspbery Pi running pihole which acts as the DNS for my network. In the past I've also used Raspberry Pi to create a separate network which then uses a VPN or PPTP to do various things. Another project I used squid to monitor traffic from mobile devices. In other words, I like to tinker. Web Apps/Toys Over the years I have sarted many projects and the majority were never completed or launched at any level outside personal or very limited use, but I can not let them die and have a very slim chance of being revived. Some projects include: mdbin : Created in April 2015 and ran until October 2016, this was a pastebin like site with Markdown rendering, options upon creation include time expiry and password protection option. This was used mostly by myself and between a group of students for University of work. I experimented with using SQLite in this project. Youtube Downloader : I started this in late 2014 due to a friend having no internet access, this would allow the user to add multiple links to vide page and it would download the highest quality available (allowing the files to be moved to external storage device and watched later), a unique part of this is it would handle playlists. ID Depot : A web based system I developed for a client in late 2014 for creating, updating and renewing ID cards in organisations. Travian Helper : A collection of tools and calculators for the relatively simple browser strategy game "Travian", this was actually used by a decent number of users from mid 2013 until early 2015 when I lost interest in the game due to significant changes, which made the site less relevant now. This was written in OOP PHP and MySQL. minecraft-skin-viewer : I created this website initally in May 2013 during my time at College for a side project, it was popular enough to give me regular pocket money from ads on the site. I sold the website and domain in August 2014 and has been running successfully for 5 years since. TravianX : I was an active contributor (late 2011 to mid 2013) to an open source clone of a MMORTS game, 'Travian'. I played this game for a long time and found this project, this project which got me into programming and web development. I'd go on to create other projects based on this game later. I still have many friends from my time working on this project.

docs.text: Uni I joined the University of Strathclyde into the second year of the Computer Science degree which lasted four years (which I passed with Distinction). Here you can see a brief description about the classes taken and the projects undertaken in each. CS2 (DipHE) 7 Classes CS3 (BSc) 6 Classes CS4 (BSc Hons 5 Classes
docs.title: Summary

docs.text: I joined the University of Strathclyde into the second year of the Computer Science degree which lasted four years (which I passed with Distinction). Here you can see a brief description about the classes taken and the projects undertaken in each. CS2 (DipHE) 7 Classes CS3 (BSc) 6 Classes CS4 (BSc Hons 5 Classes
docs.title: Uni

docs.text: Year 2 (DipHE) CS-203 Topics in Computing 2 Type: Theory and Algorithms Weekly assignments: n-cube and snake-in-the-box problem Digital door locks and de Bruijn graphs Robotic scheduling and alternation graphs Sequences, morphisms and fractal shapes Permutation patterns Crucial and bicrucial words and permutations Combinatorial proofs and identities; bijections The sigma notation ; binomial and multinomial theorems Bijections between 123-(or 321-) and 132-avoiding permutations Other assignments: Introduction to AI Introduction to Haskell CS-207 Advanced Programming Type: Software Construction Assignments: Assignment 1: ( Screenshots ) Caeser (ROT) Cipher Stack implementations using arrays and java.util. ArrayList Stack and Queue implementations using java.util.Stack and java.util. LinkedList Circular Queue array implementation Simple stock and shares application Assignment 2: ( Screenshots ) Fibonacci number /sequence iterative and recursive Pivoting Quicksort Collection sorting Binary search tree (int) Binary search tree (String) Binary search tree (generic) Assignment 3: ( Screenshots ) Adjacency Matrix Adjacency List Topological sort of directed graph Decision tree guessing game Assignment 4: Implementation of the Countdown TV game show All in Java CS-208 Logic and Algorithms Type: Theory and Algorithms Assignments: Logic, languages of [wffs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Well-formed_formula, conversion from natural language, proof steps, proofs, soundness and completeness Logic: inference and truth, satisfaction and truth assignment; truth, lies and damned lies Lambda calculus : substitution, free variables, beta-reduction Lambda calculus: higher-level views and reduction, deducing a combinator, NOR and NAND, numbers and zero Algorithms and complexity Tree construction and search, Balanced binary trees Kruskal's algorithm - minimum spanning tree, Dijkstra's algorithm - minimum path length, Prim's algorithm - minimum weight spaning tree CS-209 User and Data Modelling Type: Information Systems Data modelling assignments: DB design HCI Weekly assignments: Good and bad designs for alarm clocks Design a smartphone based central heating controller Design a microwave for visually impaired users Collect examples of interfaces that are not designed to take likely human errors into account List how you think emotions would affect a user using a computer system Design a digital camera Ubiquitous computing solutions Design storyboards for an app to assist disabled people to various locations, with some of the issues that may be faced and how your app deals with those Main HCI assignment: The aim was to design an app for a community group I, a friend, or a family member is involved with. First I had to gather requirements, then design the app. I designed app for college radio station. Hierarchical task analysis (HTA), State transition network (STN), Red routes. CS-210 Computer Systems and Architecture Type: Computer Systems Assignments: ( Screenshots ) Report on a comparison of the performance and features of a DEC PDP-11/10 with a typical desktop/laptop computer that someone (now) would have access to 40 years after the PDP-11, and attempt to predict the performance and features of a typical computer used in another 40 years from now. Report looking at the list of benchmarks in the SPEC CPU2006 discussing whether the component suite include applications that match the ways you typically use your computer etc A C program for "interpreting" ARM instructions A C program for showing the pipeline values in MIPS A C program that acts as a simple shell ARM MIPS Shell CS-211 Professional Issues in Computing Type: Theory Assignments: Individual essay - topics including "Data Protection and Data Privacy", "Intellectual Property, Copyright; Downloading and Piracy in the Workplace" and "Computer Miususe; Public Computer Access". Group website CS-214 Approaches in Multimedia Assignments: ( Screenshots ) Python game: Simple number guessing Python game: Square chase Python game: Flappy Doge Number Guessing Square Chase Flappy Dug (Doge)
docs.title: Year 2 (DipHE)

docs.text: Year 3 (BSc) CS-308 Building Software Systems Type: Software Construction Assignments: ( Screenshots ) Java: Directed graph implementation and breadth-first search - Boston metro system Java: Stock folio tracker Java: Pinball simulator with edit mode and solid physics Boston Metro System Stock Folio Tracker Gizmoball Application takes a directed graph in the form of a text file and this application contructs the directed graph and finds the shortest path between two points This application allows folios of shares to be bought and sold, tracks changes and loss/gain Gizmoball, this pinball simulator has an edit and run mode, you can add gizmos/bumpers to the game board and the ball(s) will go crazy! Application has correct and customisable physics CS-310 Foundations of Artificial Intelligence Type: Theory and Algorithms Assignments: Java: MIU system - next states, computing path, breadth-first search , depth limited depth-first search , iterative deepening , path checking, node checking, maintaining optimality Java: Write a search algorithm ( A* ) for solving mazes, the algorithm needs to be optimal, fast and scale well to large mazes. Java: Write an AI agent for the game 2048 Java: Write an AI agent for the game Pacman CS-311 Programming Language Definition and Implementation Type: Theory and Algorithms Assignments: * Java: Add type checking and interpretation layers to create an interactive calculator that can accept our custom designed language as input, and either report a syntax error, or else a correctly-formed program and report its https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denotational_semantics . Also had to produce a detailed report of additions and how the project was approached. CS-312 Web Applications Development Type: Information Systems Assignments: ( Screenshots ) PHP: Adventure Airlines - A simple flight booking system using PHP and PDO CS-313 Computer Systems and Concurrency Type: Computer Systems Assignments: ( Screenshots ) Java: Multi-threaded application server. Basically an [echo server](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Echo_Protocol, a client sends a string and the server will send a message containing the character and digit count of that string. Client can also send a file from their file system too Java: Virtual memory manager simulator Java: Caching and forwarding web proxy server Multi-threaded application server Virtual memory management simulator Multi-threaded caching and forwarding server CS-317 Mobile Applications Development Type: Software Construction Assignments: ( Screenshots ) HTML, JS: Currency converter HTML, JS: Breakout game | | |
docs.title: Year 3 (BSc)

Application has correct and customisable physics

docs.text: Year 4 (BSc Hons.) CS-408 Individual Project Type: Software Construction Natural Deduction Overall Aims: Design and implement a tool for building and nicely displaying natural deduction proofs of formulas within propositional logic. Create support for teaching of natural deduction within the application. Application must be able to check proof tree(s) for validity/correctness. Allow for generation of proof trees with error(s) and ask user to identify them. Automated generation of a formula and ask user to generate proof tree by selecting suitable formulas. CS-409 Software Architecture and Design Type: Software Construction Assignments: Java: Reverse engineer class diagrams from source code using javaparser into a format to be used with nomnoml . Java: Orrery application in JHotDraw CS-412 Information Access and Mining Type: Information Systems Assignments: Java: Application with Lucene. Implementing system for searching email. CS-413 Embedded Systems Type: Information Systems Assignments: Python, JS: Remote control car using websockets - involved creation of a gadget which we had to build and production of planning phase with documentation as well as final documentation detailing how the project was undertaken with detailed technical manual and user guides. CS-414 Digital Forensics Type: Information Systems Assignments: Report on legal and jurisdiction issues in cybercrime Report on encrypted file systems
docs.title: Year 4 (BSc Hons)

docs.text: Type: Software Construction Natural Deduction Overall Aims: Design and implement a tool for building and nicely displaying natural deduction proofs of formulas within propositional logic. Create support for teaching of natural deduction within the application. Application must be able to check proof tree(s) for validity/correctness. Allow for generation of proof trees with error(s) and ask user to identify them. Automated generation of a formula and ask user to generate proof tree by selecting suitable formulas.
